resources.string: Look twice; cyclists can go faster than you think

These are typical scenarios one may encounter when cycling or driving. Contact the local motor vehicle department for specific advice in your local area. 

Observe & Learn 
	This app is just a starting point for Driving Smart and Cycling Smart. Learn from your own and others' encounters.


Don't blame; Tolerate and Educate 
	Share this app with your friends. Pass on your knowledge to others.


Take Responsibility for your Safety 
	Don't rely on others' correct action for your safety. Give yourself some margin for error.


Learn More 
	Many resources exist on the Internet such as
"http://bicyclesafe.com/" and 
"http://www.bikeleague.org/"

string-array.name: scenario0DriverTips
string-array.item: Do you see the cyclist in the bike lane?

string-array.name: scenario1DriverTips
string-array.item: Don\'t run the red light or stop sign
Look twice; cyclists can go faster than you think
Watch for "wrong-way" cyclists coming from your right
Put down the cell phone; don\'t drive distracted

string-array.name: scenario2DriverTips
string-array.item: Use your turn signal
Watch for cyclists on sidewalk
Watch for cyclists if cars are turning left in front of you
Clean your windshield
Wear sunglasses and use the visor if there is glare

string-array.name: scenario3DriverTips
string-array.item: Slow down; let cyclist go ahead if unsafe to pass
Cyclists can go faster than you think
Use turn signal
Watch for cyclists on sidewalk
Watch for "wrong-way" cyclists

string-array.name: scenario4DriverTips
string-array.item: Look in mirrors, then look again
Look over your left shoulder
Open door slowly

string-array.name: scenario5DriverTips
string-array.item: Look in mirrors, then look again
Use turn signal
Pull out slowly, look in mirrors again

string-array.name: scenario0CycleTips
string-array.item: Does this look safe?

string-array.name: scenario1CycleTips
string-array.item: Pay attention to cars on your right
Verify that car is stopped
Slow down and be ready to brake
Ride as far as possible to the left in bike lane
Be visible - use a front light
Don\'t run a red light or stop sign

string-array.name: scenario2CycleTips
string-array.item: Slow down, determine if driver sees you
Verify that car is stopped
Be visible - use a front light
Don\'t pass cars on the right
Don\'t ride on the sidewalk

string-array.name: scenario3CycleTips
string-array.item: Glance to the left before approaching an intersection
Ride as far to the left as possible in bike lane
Don\'t ride on the sidewalk
Don\'t pass stopped or slow cars on the right
Lose the ear buds, you may hear a car next to you

string-array.name: scenario4CycleTips
string-array.item: Try to see if car is occupied: tail lights on?
Slow down and be ready to brake
Check if it is safe to leave bike lane
Ride as far to the left as possible in bike lane
Be visible - use a front light

string-array.name: scenario5CycleTips
string-array.item: Anticipate car may pull-out: tail lights or turn signal on?
Slow down and be ready to brake
Ride as far to the left as possible in bike lane
Be visible - use a front light
Check if it is safe to leave bike lane

string-array.name: scenarioTitles
